phrases.text: Hơ ớ Duyên cắc cớ ớ

culturalContext.description: Opening invocation about fate and causation, setting philosophical tone
facts: Hò đối đáp = call-and-response rowing song
Duyên (fate) is central concept in Vietnamese love/life philosophy
Cắc cớ (reason) suggests questioning one's circumstances

phrases.english: By chance I met you again

culturalContext.description: Describes chance encounter, common theme in Vietnamese folk songs
facts: Tình cờ (by chance) contrasts with duyên (destined fate)
Casual encounter that may lead to romance

phrases.text: Này anh ôi nợ oan ương nó dồn dập nó theo hoài ơ ơ
phrases.english: Oh brother, the debt of ill-fated love keeps pressing, keeps following

culturalContext.description: Lament about karmic love debt, oan ương (mandarin ducks) symbolize fated but troubled love
facts: Nợ oan ương = debt of ill-fated romance
Oan ương (mandarin ducks) represent inseparable couples
Dồn dập (pressing) conveys emotional burden
culturalContext.musicalContext: Emotional complaint with extended melodic line

phrases.text: Chào bạn lang lắng tai nghe ta hòa ớ
phrases.english: Greetings friend, listen carefully as I harmonize

culturalContext.description: Invitation to listen, bạn lang (friend) creates intimate dialogue
facts: Lắng tai (listen carefully) requests full attention
Hòa (harmonize) suggests musical and emotional attunement
Common call-and-response transition phrase

culturalContext.description: Pure vocables marking musical interlude or breath
facts: Creates rhythmic space between narrative sections
Allows rowers to synchronize movements

phrases.text: Này anh ơi chữ lương duyên của ai mà anh vô đây anh gà nghĩa ơ ơ ơ
phrases.english: Hey there, whose marriage fate is it that you come here without understanding righteousness?

culturalContext.description: Challenging question about propriety and marriage customs
facts: Lương duyên = marriage destiny/affinity
Gà nghĩa = not understanding righteousness/propriety
Questions the other's intentions and moral understanding
culturalContext.musicalContext: Long questioning phrase with rising inflection

phrases.text: Chào bạn lang toan bảy toan hò xê xang hò ơ
phrases.english: Greetings friend, planning seven plans, hey there busy one

culturalContext.description: Response refrain acknowledging complexity and busyness
facts: Toan bảy toan = making many plans
Xê xang = scattered/busy state
Common response pattern in đối đáp (call-and-response)

phrases.text: mà tôi sợ ông trời đầy ơ cái kiếp mà sau
phrases.english: But I fear heaven's full judgment on the life after

culturalContext.description: Expresses fear of karmic consequences and afterlife judgment
facts: Ông trời = heaven/heavenly father
Đầy = repay/fulfill karmic debt
Kiếp mà sau = future life/reincarnation

phrases.text: Quân tử tồn hò sự cống hò ơ ơ
phrases.english: The gentleman endures, hey, the tribute/duty, hey

culturalContext.description: References Confucian ideal of gentleman enduring duty
facts: Quân tử = Confucian gentleman ideal
Sự cống = tribute or moral duty
Classical moral reference in folk song context

phrases.text: Nhạn lạc bầy khó gầy duyên oanh én em ơi
phrases.english: Swallows separated from flock, hard to build affinity, orioles and swallows my dear

culturalContext.description: Bird metaphors for romantic separation and difficulty finding mate
facts: Nhạn lạc bầy = lone bird, symbol of solitude
Gầy duyên = difficult to create romantic connection
Oanh én = paired songbirds, symbol of romantic harmony
culturalContext.musicalContext: Lyrical metaphorical phrase with natural imagery

phrases.text: nghĩa vợ tình chồng thì núp lẻn yêu nhau ơ ơ
phrases.english: Wife's duty and husband's love, then hide secretly to love each other

culturalContext.description: Describes proper marital relationship balanced with discretion
facts: Nghĩa vợ tình chồng = proper marital roles
Núp lẻn = hide/be discreet about affection
Reflects traditional values about public vs private love

phrases.text: Chào bạn lang lắng tai nghe ta Hò ơ
phrases.english: Greetings friend, listen carefully to me, hey

culturalContext.description: Repeated call for attention, marks transition in dialogue
facts: Same as phrase #4, creates structural repetition
Maintains call-and-response rhythm

phrases.text: Em ơi có gặp cảnh khó nghèo sớm cháo chiều rau
phrases.english: Darling, if you meet hardship and poverty, morning porridge evening vegetables

culturalContext.description: Poses hypothetical about enduring poverty together
facts: Sớm cháo chiều rau = frugal lifestyle (porridge breakfast, vegetable dinner)
Common test of true love - will you stay if poor?
Reflects rural Vietnamese poverty concerns

phrases.text: thì em ơi hãy vui dạ ơ ơ
phrases.english: Then my dear, please be happy-hearted

culturalContext.description: Gentle advice to maintain contentment despite hardship
facts: Vui dạ = happy heart, inner contentment
Reflects Buddhist/Confucian ideals of inner peace
Completes the poverty hypothetical with moral lesson

phrases.text: Chào bạn lang toan bảy toan hò xang xế
phrases.english: Greetings friend, planning seven plans, hey there scattered one

culturalContext.description: Variant of earlier response refrain, xang xế adds slightly different nuance
facts: Similar to phrase #7 but xang xế instead of xê xang
Both mean scattered/busy but with different tones
Structural repetition with variation
Pure musical/functional element
Allows breath and rowing coordination

phrases.text: Chớ anh có biết liệu làm ơ sao hỡi mình ơ
phrases.english: Don't you know how to consider what to do, oh my dear?

culturalContext.description: Rhetorical question about wisdom and decision-making
facts: Liệu = to consider carefully, to plan wisely
Challenges the other's judgment and planning
Reflects importance of wisdom in relationships

phrases.text: Quân ơ tử tồn hò xự cống xê
phrases.english: Oh gentleman endures, hey, the duty/tribute continues

culturalContext.description: Closing moral reference echoing earlier Confucian theme
facts: Echoes phrase #9, creates circular structure
Quân tử = moral ideal throughout the dialogue
Ends with enduring duty despite life's challenges
culturalContext.musicalContext: Closing phrase returning to opening philosophical theme

statistics.dominantPattern: Complex call-and-response with philosophical, romantic, and moral themes
